alert.note: Alert for Broward; Palm Beach (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 07 at 3:20PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 318 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains moving slowly northeast from Northeast Broward County into Southeast Palm Beach County. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area with these heavy rains. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning may be needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Boynton Beach, Delray Beach, Highland Beach, Ocean Ridge, Coconut Creek, Parkland, Kings Point, Whisper Walk, Hamptons At Boca Raton, Dunes Road, Mission Bay, Boca Del Mar, Boca Pointe, Village Of Golf, Loxahatchee NWR, Gulf Stream, Briny Breezes and Morikami Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
